cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi east of Melbourne, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast parallel to the southeast U.S. coast, then accelerating northeastward offshore of the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest coastal encounter near the Outer Banks of North Carolina (no direct landfall expected)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast, coastal North Carolina, and offshore Mid-Atlantic to New England waters
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Monday night through Tuesday with gusts 25-35 mph, low probability (≤2%) of gale-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Long-period swells and minor coastal inundation/rip currents possible; surge heights below 3 ft expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands, generally ≤1 inch, possible Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions for vessels transiting Delaware Bay and the offshore shipping lanes
